body:
1. Echo the property tests status during builds. Property-based tests are silently auto-enabled by default if librapidcheck is found. This commit allows users to see their build status.

2. Improve the `--with-rapidcheck` package option help and code docs.

3. Add a `--disable-prop-tests` feature option. For now, it does the same as the rapidcheck option, with the essential difference that it documents in `./configure --help` how to disable them. This is helpful because the prop tests are enabled by default if librapidcheck is found, yet are an experimental feature and can block builds with compilation errors. It seems to me it would be user-friendly to show how to disable them in the help.

Build output:

```
Options used to compile and link:
  with wallet   = yes
  with gui / qt = yes
    with bip70  = yes
    with qr     = yes
  with zmq      = yes
  with test     = yes
    with prop   = yes
    with fuzz   = no
  with bench    = no
```

Configure --help output:

```
Optional Features:
  --disable-tests         do not compile tests (default is to compile)
  --disable-gui-tests     do not compile GUI tests (default is to compile if
                          GUI and tests enabled)
  --disable-prop-tests    disable property-based tests (enabled by default if
                          librapidcheck is found)
  --disable-bench         do not compile benchmarks (default is to compile)

...

Optional Packages:
  --with-PACKAGE[=ARG]    use PACKAGE [ARG=yes]
  --without-PACKAGE       do not use PACKAGE (same as --with-PACKAGE=no)
...
  --with-miniupnpc        enable UPNP (default is yes if libminiupnpc is
                          found)
  --with-rapidcheck       build with RapidCheck property-based tests (default
                          is yes if librapidcheck is found)
  --with-qrencode         enable QR code support (default is yes if qt is
                          enabled and libqrencode is found)
```
title: autoconf: property tests status and options
